Sentencas: Mechanistic studies, utilizing molecular dynamics (MD) and density functional theory (DFT) calculations, were undertaken to provide a molecular level explanation of Ba cation segregation in double perovskite GdBaCo2O5+delta (GBCO) electrodes.
Titulo: Controlling surface cation segregation in a nanostructured double perovskite GdBaCo2O5+δ electrode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The energy (gamma) of the terminal surface having only Ba cations, indicated the surface to be the most stable (gamma = 6.7 kJ mol(-1) angstrom(-2)) as compared to the other surfaces.
Titulo: Controlling surface cation segregation in a nanostructured double perovskite GdBaCo2O5+δ electrode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: MD simulations elaborated on the cation disorder in the near surface region where Ba cations in the subsurface region were observed to migrate towards the surface.
Titulo: Controlling surface cation segregation in a nanostructured double perovskite GdBaCo2O5+δ electrode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: This led to a disruption in cation ordering with a propensity to form multiphases in the near surface region.
Titulo: Controlling surface cation segregation in a nanostructured double perovskite GdBaCo2O5+δ electrode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In the near surface zone, oxygen anion diffusivity was observed to be reduced by an order of magnitude (D = 1.6 x 10(-11)
Titulo: Controlling surface cation segregation in a nanostructured double perovskite GdBaCo2O5+δ electrode for solid oxide fuel cells
Controlling surface cation segregation in a nanostructured double perovskite GdBaCo2O5+δ electrode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: s(-1) at 873 K) as compared to the bulk oxygen anion diffusivity value (D = 1.96 x 10(-10) cm(2) s(-1) at 873 K).
Titulo: Controlling surface cation segregation in a nanostructured double perovskite GdBaCo2O5+δ electrode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: A novel idea was then proposed to control the degree of surface segregation of Ba cations by applying nanostructuring of the GBCO material in the form of nanoparticles.
Titulo: Controlling surface cation segregation in a nanostructured double perovskite GdBaCo2O5+δ electrode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: MD simulations elucidated that the near surface region having a high degree of cation disorder in the nanostructured GBCO may regain back the oxygen anion diffusivity value (D = 3.98 x 10(-10)
Titulo: Controlling surface cation segregation in a nanostructured double perovskite GdBaCo2O5+δ electrode for solid oxide fuel cells

Titulo: Controlling surface cation segregation in a nanostructured double perovskite GdBaCo2O5+δ electrode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: A proof of concept experiment was setup to test this hypothesis.
Titulo: Controlling surface cation segregation in a nanostructured double perovskite GdBaCo2O5+δ electrode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The electrochemical performance of the electrode, fabricated using GBCO nanoparticles, was measured to improve by 15% as compared to the electrode synthesized with a bulk size GBCO material.
Titulo: Controlling surface cation segregation in a nanostructured double perovskite GdBaCo2O5+δ electrode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: This was attributed to the control in Ba-cation segregation, obtained on nanostructuring which resulted in higher oxygen anion transport in the near-surface region of the electrode material.
Titulo: Controlling surface cation segregation in a nanostructured double perovskite GdBaCo2O5+δ electrode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: XPS characterization of the surface of the nanostructured GBCO materials supported this assertion.
Titulo: Controlling surface cation segregation in a nanostructured double perovskite GdBaCo2O5+δ electrode for solid oxide fuel cells
